item.title: Sachin add a quote by W.B. Yeats
item.description: "What can be explained is not poetry." -- W.B. Yeats

item.title: Sachin add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "I have never listened to anyone who criticized my taste in space travel, sideshows or gorillas. When this occurs, I pack up my dinosaurs and leave the room." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Sachin add a quote by Rita Mae Brown
item.description: "I think the reward for conformity is that everyone likes you except yourself." -- Rita Mae Brown

item.title: Sachin add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "Nature is a haunted house--but Art--is a house that tries to be haunted." -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Sachin add a quote by Dylan Thomas
item.description: "A good poem is a contribution to reality. The world is never the same once a good poem has been added to it. A good poem helps to change the shape of the universe, helps to extend everyone's knowledge of himself and the world around him." -- Dylan Thomas

item.title: Sachin add a quote by Pablo Picasso
item.description: "The chief enemy of creativity is good sense." -- Pablo Picasso

item.title: Sachin add a quote by Anton Pavlovich Chekhov
item.description: "The role of the artist is to ask questions, not answer them." -- Anton Pavlovich Chekhov

item.title: Sachin add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "The secret of life is honesty and fair dealing. If you can fake that, you've got it made." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Sachin add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "I sent the club a wire stating, PLEASE ACCEPT MY RESIGNATION. I DON'T WANT TO BELONG TO ANY CLUB THAT WILL ACCEPT ME AS A MEMBER." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Sachin add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Politics is the art of looking for trouble, finding it everywhere, diagnosing it incorrectly and applying the wrong remedies." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Sachin add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "A man is only as old as the woman he feels." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Sachin add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "Forgive, O Lord, my little jokes on Thee And I'll forgive Thy great big one on me." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Sachin add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "The secret of poetry is never explained - is always new. We have not got farther than mere wonder at the delicacy of the touch, & the eternity it inherits. In every house a child that in mere play utters oracles, & knows not that they are such. 'Tis as easy as breath. 'Tis like this gravity, which holds the Universe together, & none knows what it is." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Sachin add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Poets are shameless with their experiences: they exploit them." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Sachin add a quote by Clifton Fadiman
item.description: "Don't be afraid of poetry." -- Clifton Fadiman

item.title: Sachin add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Was not writing poetry a secret transaction, a voice answering a voice?" -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Sachin add a quote by Samuel Taylor Coleridge
item.description: "Sir, I admit your general rule, That every poet is a fool, But you yourself may serve to show it, That every fool is not a poet." -- Samuel Taylor Coleridge

item.title: Sachin add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Learn from the mistakes of others. You can never live long enough to make them all yourself." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Sachin add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "I don’t have a photograph, but you can have my footprints. They’re upstairs in my socks." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Sachin add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Just give me a comfortable couch, a dog, a good book, and a woman. Then if you can get the dog to go somewhere and read the book, I might have a little fun." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Sachin add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "No one is completely unhappy at the failure of his best friend." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Sachin add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Only one man in a thousand is a leader of men -- the other 999 follow women." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Sachin add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Marriage is a wonderful institution...but who wants to live in an institution?" -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Sachin add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "I’ll put off reading <i>Lolita</i> for six more years until she turns 18." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Sachin add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "From the moment I picked your book up until I laid it down, I convulsed with laughter. Someday I intend on reading it." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Sachin add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Whatever it is, I'm against it." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Sachin add a quote by Jacques Derrida
item.description: "To pretend, I actually do the thing: I have therefore only pretended to pretend." -- Jacques Derrida

item.title: Sachin add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "The man of knowledge must be able not only to love his enemies but also to hate his friends." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Sachin add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "There are no beautiful surfaces without a terrible depth." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Sachin add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Doubt as sin. — Christianity has done its utmost to close the circle and declared even doubt to be sin. One is supposed to be cast into belief without reason, by a miracle, and from then on to swim in it as in the brightest and least ambiguous of elements: even a glance towards land, even the thought that one perhaps exists for something else as well as swimming, even the slightest impulse of our amphibious nature — is sin! And notice that all this means that the foundation of belief and all reflection on its origin is likewise excluded as sinful. What is wanted are blindness and intoxication and an eternal song over the waves in which reason has drowned." -- Friedrich Nietzsche
